# What is this about
Yeah, I gave myself 15 mins to write this first bit. I am a story as old as time so not going too much further there. I need to get some sh!t done and this is a way for me to put that fire to my feet. Put it out into the tiniest little cracked corner of the inner-nets under a decade's worth of piled dust that was always just barely missed when the floor was swept.

Yeah, that'll do it. That'll make my productivity skyrocket. Motivate me to do that thing echoing my brain that gets more lost as the cave loses light.

But seriously, I'm curious, so I ask, what is this sh!t?.

Bon Voyage.

Gemini Prompt:

You are a fitness expert. Create a preseason workout plan for a 14 year old male preparing for upcoming baseball season. The plan should include speed and endurance training with some strength training for core and lower body

Note: I spent all of 1 min on this prompt. This is not medical advice.

---

# âš¾ Preseason Baseball Pitcher Training Plan (Age 14)

This plan is designed to build a powerful lower half, a stable core, and a durable arm. It balances speed, endurance, and pitching-specific explosive power.

## ðŸ“… Weekly Schedule Overview

| Day | Focus | Primary Goal |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Monday** | Speed & Rotational Power | Acceleration & Med Ball Throws |
| **Tuesday** | Strength & Arm Care | Leg Foundation & Shoulder Stability |
| **Wednesday** | Active Recovery | Mobility & Light Aerobic Base |
| **Thursday** | Agility & Lateral Power | Lateral Movement & Reactive Strength |
| **Friday** | Pitching Strength & Core | Single-leg Stability & Towel Drills |
| **Weekend** | Long Toss & Rest | Arm Conditioning & Recovery |

---

## ðŸƒ Day 1: Speed & Rotational Power

*Focus: Explosive movements and core rotation.*

* **Dynamic Warm-up (10 mins):** High knees, butt kicks, leg swings, arm circles.
* **60-Foot Sprints:** 6 reps. (Full speed from home to first). Walk back for recovery.
* **5-10-5 Pro-Agility Shuttle:** 4 reps. Sprint 5 yards right, 10 yards left, 5 yards back to center.
* **Med Ball Rotational Side Toss:** 3 sets of 8 reps per side. (4-6lb ball). Focus on "loading" the back hip and firing through the core.
* **Med Ball Overhead Slams:** 3 sets of 10 reps. Reach high on toes and slam the ball down hard.

---

## ðŸ’ª Day 2: Strength & Arm Care

*Focus: Building the "Engine" (legs) and protecting the shoulder.*

* **Goblet Squats:** 3 sets of 12 reps. Hold weight at chest level; keep heels flat.
* **Forward & Lateral Lunges:** 3 sets of 10 reps per leg. (Step forward, then step out to the side).
* **J-Bands / Resistance Band Rotations:** 2 sets of 15 reps (Internal and External rotation).
* **Y-W-T Holds:** 3 sets of 10 reps. Lie on stomach, lift arms to form letters Y, W, and T. Hold each for 2 seconds.
* **Plank with Shoulder Taps:** 3 sets of 45 seconds. Keep hips level.

---

## ðŸ§˜ Day 3: Active Recovery & Mobility

*Focus: Flushing out soreness and increasing range of motion.*

* **Light Jog or Bike:** 15â€“20 minutes at a "conversational" pace.
* **T-Spine (Upper Back) Rotations:** 2 sets of 10 reps per side.
* **90/90 Hip Stretch:** 2 minutes per side.
* **Childâ€™s Pose / Lat Stretch:** 2 sets of 30 seconds.

---

## âš¡ Day 4: Agility & Lateral Power

*Focus: The side-to-side power needed for the pitching mound.*

* **Lateral Bounds:** 3 sets of 10 reps. Jump side-to-side, landing softly and holding balance.
* **Skaters:** 3 sets of 12 reps. Fast, explosive side-to-side jumps.
* **Med Ball Step-Into Lateral Toss:** 3 sets of 8 reps per side. Mimic your pitching stride while throwing the ball sideways.
* **Dead Bugs:** 3 sets of 15 reps. Keep your lower back pressed firmly into the floor.

---

## âš¾ Day 5: Pitching Strength & Core

*Focus: Single-leg stability and mechanical consistency.*

* **Bulgarian Split Squats:** 3 sets of 10 reps per leg. (Back foot elevated on a bench or chair).
* **Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift:** 3 sets of 8 reps per leg. Balance on one leg, hinge at hips, touch the floor.
* **Towel Drill:** 25 reps. Use a hand towel to go through your full pitching motion; focus on a strong finish.
* **Russian Twists:** 3 sets of 20 reps.
* **Glute Bridges:** 3 sets of 15 reps. Squeeze glutes at the top.

---

## ðŸ“ˆ Pitcherâ€™s Ramp-Up Guide (Weekends)

Do not go 100% effort in the first week. Gradually build your arm "gas tank."

1. **Weeks 1-2:** Saturdays focus on **Long Toss**. Keep a high arc. Max distance 120 feet.
2. **Weeks 3-4:** Add **Flat Ground** sessions on Wednesdays. Throw your arsenal (Fastball/Changeup) on flat ground to work on grips.
3. **Weeks 5+:** Begin **Mound Bullpens**. Start with 15â€“20 pitches and increase the count by 5â€“10 each week until you reach your game target.

---

## ðŸ’¡ Expert Notes

* **Hydration:** Drink half your body weight in ounces of water daily.
* **Pain vs. Soreness:** Muscle soreness is okay. Sharp pain in the elbow or front of the shoulder means **STOP** and rest.
* **Consistency:** It is better to do a 20-minute workout every day than a 2-hour workout once a week.

---

// Typed Try Catch

import { CustomResult } from "@/types/neverthrow" // May need to figure out what this is?

interface TryCatchOptions {
	errorMessage?: string;
}

export async function asyncTryCatch<T> (
	promise: Promise<T>,
	options: TryCatchOptions,
): Promise<CustomResult<T, Error>> {
	try {
		
		const data = await promise
		return {success: true, data }

	} catch (error: unkown) {
		return {
			success: false,
			error: error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(options?.errorMessage ?? String(error))
		}
	}
}
